page.title: 18Golden Wonder Crisps, Corby.
page.content: Golden Wonder is a household name and has an important part of its operations in Corby. At one time it was the largest producer of potato crisps in Europe. The company was one of the first to arrive in Corby, providing a valuable source of female employment on the Earlstrees industrial estate, in 1964. Golden Wonder chose Corby for a variety of reasons-the workers were used to shift work, an important consideration in 24 hour operations, the geographical location of the town places it near the fenlands of East Anglia producing the bulk of Britain's potatoes and within a hondred mile radius of the town there is a potential consumer population of 30 million people. The company has continued to show confidence in the town despite a recent strike by re-investing in the plant.
